author: Katie Wadington
description: President Trump on Sunday revealed a new detail about the hyped UFC fight set to take place on the South Lawn of the White House: It'll occur on June 14, which is also his 80th birthday. In remarks in Norfolk, Va., at a celebration of the Navy's 250th anniversary, the president reveled in the major...
title: Trump reveals date for White House's UFC fight: His 80th birthday

author: Tara Suter
description: Oregon Attorney General Dan Rayfield on Sunday said he is “preparing to take legal action” against President Trump for sending California National Guard troops to the Beaver State. “We are quickly assessing our options and preparing to take legal action. We’ll continue to share updates as we have them,” Rayfield said in a post on...
title: Oregon AG ‘preparing to take legal action’ against Trump sending California National Guard troops

author: Ella Lee
description: Presidential powers, LGBTQ rights and the role of race in elections are among a spate of high-profile issues before the Supreme Court as the justices take the bench Monday to begin a new term.  The court is poised to review 39 argued cases so far, including President Trump’s bid to keep his most significant economic...
title: 5 issues to watch as Supreme Court kicks off new term

author: Tara Suter
description: Sen. Tammy Duckworth (D-Ill.) on Sunday went after Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, saying the military “could not do its job” without “the women who serve.” “Well, this is the least qualified secretary of Defense in our nation's history, and he's questioning the ability of the women who actually qualified to their — to do their...
title: Duckworth slams Hegseth: 'Military could not do its job' without 'the women who serve'

author: Max Rego
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) said Sunday that “no Democrat” in Congress is attempting to expand health care benefits to undocumented immigrants.  “Federal law clearly prohibits the expenditure of taxpayer dollars to provide health care to undocumented immigrants. Period, full stop,” Jeffries said on NBC’s Meet the Press. “And no Democrat on Capitol Hill...
title: Jeffries says ‘no Democrat’ trying to give health care to undocumented immigrants

author: Tara Suter
description: Washington, D.C., police on Sunday arrested a person outside of a local cathedral before a high-profile Red Mass. “Metropolitan Police Department (MPD) members assigned to a detail for the Red Mass at Saint Matthew’s Cathedral engaged an individual who set up a tent on the steps of the Cathedral,” MPD said in a Sunday statement....
title: DC Police arrest person outside St. Matthew's Cathedral ahead of Red Mass

author: Max Rego
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) said Sunday the lower chamber “did its job” in the government funding battle.  On Sept. 19, the House passed what Johnson called a “clean” and “nonpartisan” stopgap spending bill, which would fund the government through Nov. 21.  “The House did its job,” Johnson said on CBS’s "Face the Nation." “The...
title: Johnson says House 'did its job' amid funding talks

author: Max Rego
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) said Sunday that the Trump administration is deploying 300 of his state’s National Guard troops to Portland, Ore., and he vowed he would sue over the move.  On Saturday, a federal judge temporarily blocked the administration’s deployment of 200 Oregon National Guard troops to the state’s largest city. U.S. District...
title: Newsom to sue Trump over National Guard deployment, urges Americans to 'speak out'

author: Creighton Mitchell, opinion contributor
description: The panic over AI gutting junior bankers is as old as labor itself.
title: AI won’t end work for bankers — it will redefine it

author: Max Rego
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Sunday that an independent Palestinian state is “not even a realistic thing right now.” “It’s not even possible. That’s not even a realistic thing right now,” Rubio said on CBS’s Face the Nation. “Because who would govern that Palestinian state, Hamas?” The Trump administration’s 20-point plan to end the...
title: Rubio says a Palestinian state 'not even a realistic thing right now'

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) said the Trump administration’s plan to lay off thousands of federal workers is “regrettable,” but the fault is with Democrats who won’t agree to the Republicans’ proposal to reopen the government. In an interview on NBC News’s “Meet the Press,” host Kristen Welker pressed Johnson on the administration’s unprecedented plan to...
title: Johnson calls potential layoffs ‘a regrettable situation that the president does not want’

author: Julia Manchester
description: President Trump called on Democratic Virginia Attorney General nominee Jay Jones to drop out of his race over leaked text messages about former Republican state House Speaker Todd Gilbert (R).  It has just come out that the Radical Left Lunatic, Jay Jones, who is running against Jason Miyares, the GREAT Attorney General in Virginia, made...
title: Trump calls on Democratic attorney general nominee Jay Jones to drop out of race

author: Max Rego
description: Former Army Vice Chief of Staff Gen. Peter Chiarelli said he is “concerned” about Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s “attack on women” in the military on Sunday. “I'm concerned about what I considered an attack on women, and the fact that there are people who say that women have been let into different combat fields and...
title: Former Army vice chief of staff 'concerned' about Hegseth's 'attack on women'

author: Annette Nierobisz and Dana Sawchuk, opinion contributors
description: Baby boomers who lost their white-collar jobs during the 2008 Great Recession experienced vastly different financial outcomes, with some experiencing "hard falls" while others experienced "soft landings", and Gen Xers today face the same quandary with potentially even more precarious financial outcomes.
title: Gen X may be the first to need a universal basic income after late-career job loss

author: Niall Stanage
description: President Trump’s push to expand and consolidate power is ramping up on multiple fronts, even as the government shutdown holds center stage on Capitol Hill. Trump’s actions are sharpening critics’ fears about creeping authoritarianism. The shutdown and Trump’s expansive use of power are interlinked in some respects. Trump has sought new ways to ratchet up...
title: The Memo: Trump pushes boundaries of power amid shutdown

author: Julia Manchester
description: Virginia Lt. Gov. Winsome Earle-Sears’ (R) gubernatorial campaign rolled out an ad tying her Democratic opponent, Abigail Spanberger, to the fallout over leaked text messages from Democratic attorney general nominee Jay Jones.  The ad opens with a series of clips from news anchors about Jones’ unearthed 2022 text messages from Jones calling for the then-statehouse...
title: Earle-Sears ties Spanberger to Virginia AG candidate texts in new ad

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Kevin Hassett, director of the White House National Economic Council, said on Sunday that federal layoffs will take place if President Trump decides that negotiations are going nowhere. In an interview on CNN’s “State of the Union,” the NEC director signaled Republicans were far from willing to negotiate their position to end the government shutdown...
title: Hassett says layoffs will start if Trump ‘decides’ negotiations are ‘absolutely going nowhere’

author: Leeza Garber, opinion contributor
description: With easy access to photos, videos and personal information, a cybercriminal can create fraudulent accounts and donation campaigns — especially now, in an era of on-demand generative AI, deepfake apps, and voice cloning software.
title: Cyberscammers are cashing in by exploiting cancer patients — we must stop them

description: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker (D) said Trump administration officials “want to create the warzone” in Chicago to send in more National Guard troops. In an interview on CNN’s “State of the Union,” Pritzker condemned the nighttime raid in Chicago, saying it’s “emblematic” of what the Trump administration is trying to do. “This raid at this...
title: Pritzker says Trump officials “want to create the warzone’

author: Alix Martichoux
description: A tiny anthropomorphized paperclip is making a comeback as people revive Clippy's memory in protest.
title: People tired of invasive tech are bringing back Clippy

author: Max Rego
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Sunday that this is the “closest we’ve come” to securing the release of all Israeli hostages, but warned of “pitfalls” amid peace negotiations.  “This is the closest we’ve come to getting all of the hostages released, every single one.”,” Rubio said on ABC’s This Week.  On Friday, Hamas partially...
title: Rubio: 'Closest we've come' to bringing hostages home

author: Addy Bink
description: Ready to get an extra hour of sleep?
title: When does daylight saving time end, and what changes?

author: Mark R. Whittington, opinion contributor
description: It provides a sense of certainty to an undertaking that has been talked about for decades.
title: NASA’s mission around the moon now has a name and a date

author: Max Rego
description: An armed woman was shot after driving her vehicle into federal agents in Broadview, Ill., on Saturday, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) said.  According to a DHS statement obtained by NewsNation, The Hill’s sister network, the woman, Marimar Martinez, rammed agents from Customs and Border Patrol (CBP). Martinez was armed with a semi-automatic weapon,...
title: Armed woman shot after ramming law enforcement vehicle amid ICE protests: DHS

author: Brett Samuels
description: Progressive group Demand Justice on Sunday announced a six-figure ad campaign targeting two Democratic senators for voting to advance judicial nominees who had equivocated about the results of the 2020 election. Demand Justice, which has led liberal efforts to shape the federal judiciary, announced it would launch ads calling out Sen. Dick Durbin (D-Ill.) and...
title: Demand Justice targets Durbin, Coons over vote for Trump judicial nominees

author: Jonathan Alpert, opinion contributor
description: Shutdowns in Washington are a form of political catharsis that relieve tension but solve nothing, and the country is left anxious and stuck in the same cycle of venting without progress.
title: Washington’s shutdown is bad therapy — and America is the patient

author: Jeremy Tanner
description: Car shoppers who missed out on the electric vehicle tax credit shouldn't give up on finding a great deal, experts say.
title: Why it could be a good time to buy an EV, even without the $7,500 tax credit

author: Max Rego
description: President Trump is calling for Univision to return to YouTube TV, saying its recent removal is “VERY BAD” for the GOP ahead of the 2026 midterms.  “I hope Univision, a great and very popular Hispanic Network, can get BACK onto the very amazing Google/YouTube,” the president said late Saturday on his Truth Social platform. “It...
title: Trump presses for Univision return to YouTube: 'VERY BAD for Republicans'

author: Glenn C. Altschuler, opinion contributor
description: Recent restrictions by the newly renamed Department of War on news organizations come straight out of the playbook of aspiring authoritarians.
title: The Pentagon’s war on freedom of the press

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Rep. Tim Burchett (R-Tenn.) has slammed his colleagues in Congress who engage in insider trading, saying they should be "on Wall Street" instead of on Capitol Hill. "Americans understand what's going on with Congress," Burchett said Sunday on the "Cats Roundtable" radio show hosted by John Catsimatidis on WABC 770 AM. "When they see their...
title: Burchett chides colleagues over insider trading: 'Crooked as a dog‘s leg'

author: Julia Manchester
description: Disagreements among Democrats have emerged over how to conduct political messaging on the government shutdown as the party battles with the GOP over whom the public should blame for the impasse. The Democratic National Committee raised eyebrows Wednesday when it posted a shutdown explainer video featuring cats, attracting criticism from some observers who called it...
title: Democrats battle over their party’s shutdown messaging

author: Laura Kelly
description: President Trump’s top officials are raising alarm that violence on the ground in eastern Congo is outpacing U.S. efforts to implement a peace deal to end 30 years of conflict between the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda.  The warnings from Trump’s top officials counter the president’s repeated claims that he has ended “un-endable wars.”...
title: Trump’s peace hopes for Rwanda-Congo face threats

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Some U.S. schools are facing an immediate funding threat due to the government shutdown, while others are nervously eyeing their cash reserves and wondering how long the closure will last. Schools at military facilities or on Tribal land can receive a significant portion of their budget from Impact Aid, which was immediately cut off when...
title: Vulnerable schools prepare for the worst amid shutdown

author: Joseph Choi
description: Republicans in Congress have refused to negotiate an extension of Affordable Care Act (ACA) tax credits as part of talks to end the shutdown, arguing there is plenty of time to negotiate over ObamaCare once the government is funded.  “That is an issue for the end of the year. Dec. 31 is when that expires,”...
title: Why Congress is running out of time for an ObamaCare deal

author: Elliott Davis
description: Puerto Rican singer-songwriter Bad Bunny on Saturday night poked fun at the backlash he has received from conservatives since being announced as this NFL season's Super Bowl halftime show performer. The award-winning artist, hosting NBC's "Saturday Night Live" for the second time, said during his opening monologue that he is "very happy" to be Super...
title: Bad Bunny pokes fun at Super Bowl backlash, does not address ICE plans on SNL

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: White House deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller railed against a Saturday ruling that temporarily blocked President Trump’s attempts to deploy 200 National Guard soldiers to Portland, Ore. “Legal insurrection. The President is the commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces, not an Oregon judge … ,” Miller, an architect of many Trump administration immigration policies, wrote...
title: Miller on judge blocking Portland National Guard deployment: ‘Legal insurrection’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) said Democrats will caucus virtually on Monday after House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) sent his colleagues home for the next week amid the government shutdown.  “People will die. If the Affordable Care Act tax credits are not renewed in short order, millions will lose their healthcare coverage, and the...
title: Jeffries: House Democrats to meet virtually Monday as shutdown drags on

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: A new poll shows most Americans say they believe the government shutdown will last for two weeks or less, as Congress grapples with the public fallout from the first shutdown in about six years. The YouGov survey, published on Friday, found that 41 percent of Americans think the federal closure will last for two weeks...
title: Most Americans believe the shutdown will last two weeks or less: Survey
